metadata.Title: CVE-2013-0275 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in Ganglia Web before 3.5.6 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via unspecified vectors.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-0275` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ganglia-webfrontend - 3.6.0-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

notes.Note: tsimonq2> From Debian: "starting with 3.6.0-1 the web front is no longer built from src:ganglia" - can confirm

criterions.comment: ganglia-web package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.6.0-1ubuntu2').
